title: Employee Benefits Benefit Technology Implementation Consultant
description:
In a rapidly changing world, HUB advises businesses and individuals on how to prepare for the unexpected. As the 5th largest global insurance broker, our focus is dedicated to providing our customers with the peace of mind that what matters most will be protected — through unrelenting advocacy and tailored insurance solutions that put our clients in control. Our growing team of 18,000 employees in 750 offices across North America represents a broad, deep and one-of-a kind aggregation of entrepreneurs and leaders recognized for their excellence throughout the insurance community and being one of the industry’s leading success in the mergers and acquisitions.


FNA/HUB is seeking an experienced professional to join us as an Implementation Consultant. The Implementation Consultant is a key team member of the Benefits Technology Practice. The Implementation Consultant is not only responsible for the successful implementation of the enrollment platform but is the subject matter expert (SME) for all levels of the day-to-day role. Because the Implementation Consultant has personal contact with clients, it is very important for this individual to be comfortable with direct client interaction and project management. This individual will be required to carry out various aspects of the software implementation process including needs analysis, configuration, testing, training, and presentation of the software to clients. This role requires the individual to identify project goals and scope and creating a project plan that outlines tasks, timelines and resources required all while managing risks, issues, and monitoring process to ensure the project stays on track. The ideal candidate is a resource for the team and at times may need to act as a liaison between teams/partners. The candidate must have excellent organizational skills, take a proactive initiative to ensure client and team success and an ability to effectively work across matrix partners.


Job Responsibilities:

* Create and facilitate project plan
* Manage resources and projects to a given timeline
* Configure system as needed and work within the team to meet client deliverables; including, but not limited to:
	+ Configuring system as needed based on client provided requirements
	+ Testing new and existing system functionality to ensure accuracy of client system configuration with integration, regression, and acceptance test plans
	+ Establish electronic data interchange (EDI) files when appropriate
* Maintain thorough understanding of all internal systems to respond to general and specialized client requests
* Provide resolution of client issues by responding to questions and concerns about the use of HUB International products; ability to leverage research to find resolution.
* Update sites as requirements change each plan year or as needed throughout the plan year (this includes benefit class matrix, requirements document, rates, permissions, field options, site text)
* Provide open communication to HUB International customers in a pleasant, professional manner with a can-do attitude.
* Facilitate site training to clients and HUB Account Team.
* Build and maintain Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) files as deemed appropriate, to meet business objectives.
* Ability to manage multiple projects concurrently
* Ability to identify, report and track issues and/or enhancements required to meet current industry standard business rules and functionality
* Creating and maintaining procedures for the team
* Serves as a technical resource and triage point to the team
* Serves as a mentor and escalation point
* Assesses the effectiveness of team process, recommends, and implements improvements as necessary across the team


Position Qualifications

* A Bachelor’s Degree and/or 2+ years’ experience in benefits administration with a preference to online enrollment.
* Experience with Employee Navigator strongly preferred.
* Excellent written/verbal communication skills and the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical personnel; ability to listen, clarify and respond well to questions.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, Basic Functionality).
* Experience with building/maintaining Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) files a plus.
* Must be able to quickly sort through complex subject material.
* Strong analytical skill set and ability to effectively use data for strategy.
* High level of productivity, reliability, responsibility, attendance, dependability, organization, and accuracy/thoroughness.
* Ability to take initiative to meet challenges with resourcefulness and new innovative approaches while maintaining a high level of quality.
* Must possess a passion for teamwork, client service and reaching business results through problem solving.
* Proven judgement, creativity and analytical skills are required to analyze, recommend, and improve workflows.


This position description is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Employees may be required to perform any other job-related duties as requested by their supervisory, subject to reasonable accommodation.


Department Account Management & Service
Required Experience: 2-5 years of relevant experience
Required Travel: Negligible
Required Education: Bachelor's degree (4-year degree)

title: Regional Talent Development Manager (East Region)
description:
**About HUB International Limited**  

HUB International Limited is a leading North American insurance brokerage that provides a broad array of property and casualty, life and health, employee benefits, reinsurance, investment and risk management products and services throughout offices located in the United States, Canada, and Puerto Rico.


More information is available at www.hubinternational.com

**Position Summary:**


The Regional Talent Development Manager is a new role and part of the growing HUB HR team. This role is accountable for crafting and delivering development initiatives that improve the employee and leadership experience at HUB International.


The Regional Talent Development Manager will be an extension of the Corporate Talent & Organizational Development team, and a key member of the Regional HR and leadership teams. This role will be accountable for designing, delivering, and continuously improving learning and organizational development initiatives that align with HUB’s enterprise talent strategy while also supporting region-specific talent initiatives. The Regional Talent Development Manager will also facilitate various leadership and employee training within their assigned region and across the enterprise.


This position may be located anywhere within the East Coast near a HUB office and will have a hybrid work arrangement.

**Major Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Lead talent development initiatives for the enterprise, taking into consideration the breadth of our businesses, our multi-national geography and needs of employees across HUB.
* Provide support and execution for employee-centric people processes and programs that span across the employee life cycle within their assigned region.
* Provide talent development thought leadership, design, and delivery expertise for various talent segments (employees, leaders, senior executives), and development needs (leadership and career development.)
* Collaborate with stakeholders across the business and our Field and Corporate HR teams to identify and understand talent needs and help direct the design and development of programs to align with organizational goals and strategy.
* Facilitate leadership and employee development across talent segments and geographies.
* Partner closely with HR Leaders and Regional Senior Leadership team on talent related initiatives.
* Support Regional and Enterprise HUB talent projects: organizational design, change management, talent assessment, transition planning, team effectiveness.
* Design relevant and meaningful program measures and success metrics that will measure the impact of our talent development initiatives.
* Participate or lead strategic talent and organizational development (OD) initiatives – organizational design, change management, talent assessment, transition planning, team effectiveness.
* Bring an inclusion and diversity lens to all people practice development and partner with key stakeholders across the organization to implement and support DEI initiatives.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum of 5 years of progressive HR, talent, or organizational development experience
* Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a learning and facilitation role
* Learning and development expertise, with proven experience designing and delivering employee development and leadership development programs
* A customer service mindset and an ability to communicate effectively with all levels of leadership
* High level of facilitation expertise
* Blend of strategic thinking and practical execution
* Proficient in designing and using people analytics – be able to harness and use data to make informed decisions
* Understands the dynamics of a decentralized/matrix organization
* Good organizational savvy, resilient
* Ability to simultaneously and effectively manage multiple projects and priorities
* Proven project management and organizational skills
* Ability to work effectively in a diverse work group and manage ambiguous situations
* Strong computer skills: Microsoft Office, LMS systems, Learning Development technology
* Strong negotiation and influence skills
* Passion for coaching and developing talent
* Willingness to travel – up to 25%

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Four-year college degree required – graduate work or degree in organizational development, HR, Education, or related field preferred
* Demonstrated experience designing and owning talent processes is a plus
* Experience as an HR Business Partner or on an Organizational Development team is a plus
* Exposure to delivering components of Diversity, Equity & Inclusion efforts is a plus
* Experience with Learning Management Systems


Disclosure required under applicable municipal regulations in CA, NY, NJ, WA as well as the law in Colorado: The expected salary range for this position is $130K to $150K and will be impacted by factors such as the successful candidate’s skills, experience and working location, as well as the specific position’s business line, scope and level. HUB International is proud to offer comprehensive benefit and total compensation packages which could include health/dental/vision/life/disability insurance, FSA, HSA and 401(k) accounts, paid-time-off benefits, and eligible bonuses, equity and commissions.

title: Account Executive-Private Client
description:
HUB International is a leading insurance brokerage firm in all lines of insurance.


Our Private Client Team group is currently seeking an Account Executive to provide insurance and risk management consultation for high net worth clients.

**Specific responsibilities include:**

* Manages an assigned book of high-net worth personal insurance clients with personal insurance portfolios of varying size and complexity.
* Work to establish and grow substantive relationships with existing & prospective clients to deliver an excellent client experience.
* Schedules and conducts face to face & virtual meetings with clients to annual reviews. Reviews will analyze and evaluate clients’ current insurance and providing feedback and suggestions on program improvement.
* Achieves assigned annual financial metrics focused on retention & revenue growth.
* Understands carrier underwriting appetite and effectively use rating software to market accounts with various carriers prepare and present proposals, as needed.
* Reviewing accurate information on all new prospects/clients by documenting EPIC and updating client information in our agency management system accordingly.
* Additional responsibilities will include cross sell initiatives into your managed book of business as well as on an individual basis.

**Please apply to join us if you meet the following requirements:**

* 4 year college degree or equivalent work experience
* At least 3-7 years of experience in related position
* Understanding of the Private Client marketplace
* A Property & Casualty Insurance license
* Ability to manage multiple responsibilities in a deadline driven environment
* Proven ability to work independently and collaboratively with a team

title: New Business Inside Sales Representative
description:

With over 18,000 employees in 750 offices throughout North America and Canada, HUB has grown substantially, in part due to our industry leading success in mergers and acquisitions.


Hub Northeast is currently seeking a highly motivated individual interested in a career in business. Consider an entry-level position in the Property and Casualty Insurance industry! You could be part of a team managing all aspects of our clients insurance programs.


Duties

* Contact via telemarketing and email marketing decision making individuals of prospective commercial insurance clients directly to secure their interest in HUB services.
* Schedule new business appointments for HUB Producers to present HUB services to prospect and discuss present and future needs with hopes of securing new clients to the organization.

* Assist Producers in communicating with prospects via phone and/or email to move the sales process along and gather necessary underwriting information.
* Individuals with aspirations to become Producers can start their career in Inside Sales as an entry into the industry. The ISR learns the ins and outs of the business, the jargon necessary to intelligently speak with prospects, and the behaviors necessary to become a successful Producer

* College degree is preferred
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills


Hub Northeast will assist in obtaining your P&C license as well as Brokers license.

description:
HUB International Limited (“HUB”) is the 5th largest global insurance broker, providing a broad array of property, casualty, risk management, life and health, employee benefits, investment and wealth management products and services. With over 18,000 employees in 750 offices throughout North America, HUB has grown substantially, in part due to our industry leading success in mergers and acquisitions.


Hub International Northeast is seeking an Assistant Vice President for our Specialty Lines Claims Group. This position will perform a full range of claims support activities with new and existing clients including education and working on new opportunities with our sales team.


Responsibilities include but are not limited to:

* Delivery of our claims value proposition to our customers and relationships;
* Interacting with clients in-person, virtually, writing, and via phone;
* First reporting, claim investigations/fact development, preparing and presentation of claim reviews, documenting claim files, completing claim file activities, retrieving and reviewing insurance contract language, and calculating/recommending loss settlements;
* Engaging in claims advocacy relating to coverage disputes on behalf of HUB clients;
* Consistent conveyance of an exceptional customer experience to clients, customers, and business partners; and
* Adhering to Claims Department Standards while maintaining an appropriate volume of work product.


Please apply to join us if you meet the following requirements:

* A minimum of 5 years experience with handling Specialty Lines claims and/or coverage including E&O, D&O, Cyber, Crime/Fidelity, EPL and Fiduciary claims
* 4 year college degree or equivalent work experience
* Strong organizational skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively with a team
* Ability to manage multiple responsibilities in deadline driven environment
* Fluency in and understanding of litigation terms and process is essential
* J.D. preferred and CPCU a plus


Department Claims Management
Required Experience: 5-7 years of relevant experience
Required Travel: Negligible
Required Education: Bachelor's degree (4-year degree)

title: Early Career Summer Insurance Brokerage Intern
description:
**Are you ready to launch your career in insurance brokerage? Join our award-winning internship program!**

As a HUB Summer Intern you will be exposed to the vast career opportunities within the growing insurance brokerage industry. Working with our Commercial lines, Personal lines, Employee Benefits or Retirement & Private Wealth teams, you will learn about our business through on-the-job training, working closely with a variety of HUB team members to gain hands-on experience across Sales and Client Service.

**Program Highlights**

* **Network with the Best:** Work alongside seasoned professionals and industry leaders who are eager to share their knowledge and insights with you. Engage in the Speaker Series and connect with a national intern cohort for a comprehensive industry experience.
* **Meaningful Projects:** Contribute to impactful projects where your ideas and efforts are valued from day one. Collaborate with peers on a research topic and experience presenting your recommendations to an Executive Panel.
* **Professional Development:** Engage in workshops, seminars, and networking events designed to enhance your skills in communication, problem-solving, and leadership.
* **Mentorship:** Receive personalized guidance from mentors who will support your growth, answer your questions, and help you navigate the intricacies of the insurance landscape.
* **Social Experience:** Enjoy field trips, volunteer initiatives, and exciting events that foster camaraderie. Explore the industry beyond the office, give back to the community, and unwind with fellow interns during memorable activities
* **Full-Time Pathway:** Our program is strategically designed to identify and nurture exceptional talent. Outstanding interns will have the opportunity to transition into full-time roles upon graduation.


This is a full-time,10-week internship with a pay rate of $22 dollars an hour.

**Day-to-Day Responsibilities May Include:**

* Client Engagement: Collaborate with our sales and service teams to interact with clients, understand their needs, and contribute to tailored insurance solutions.
* Sales Support: Assist in sales activities such as prospect research, lead generation, and preparing client presentations.
* Policy Administration: Gain hands-on experience in managing policies, endorsements, renewals, and assisting in claims processing.
* Market Research: Contribute to market analysis and research projects, providing valuable insights for informed decision-making.
* Data Management: Assist in maintaining accurate client records, policy documentation, and other critical data.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with colleagues from different teams to gain exposure to various facets of insurance brokerage.
* Technical Training: Actively engage in workshops, training sessions, and seminars aimed at enhancing your skills and industry knowledge.
* Reporting: Prepare reports and presentations to communicate project updates, findings, and recommendations to internal stakeholders.

**Qualifications**

* Any of the following: High School Diploma or GED, College Graduates, Final Year College Students with an expected graduation date in 2025
* A positive attitude and enthusiasm to learn the insurance industry
* Excellent verbal & written communication skills
* Strong organizational skills, adept at prioritizing and handling multiple tasks
* A collaborative team player with a desire to help others
* Independent and self-motivated, capable of autonomous work
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Excel, Outlook, etc

**Who We Are**


In a rapidly changing world, HUB advises businesses and individuals on how to prepare for the unexpected. As the 5th largest global insurance broker, our focus provides our customers with the peace of mind that what matters most will be protected — through unrelenting advocacy and tailored insurance solutions that put our clients in control. Our growing team of 17,000 employees in 750 offices across North America represents a broad, deep and one-of-a kind aggregation of entrepreneurs and leaders recognized for their excellence throughout the insurance community and being one of the industry’s leading success in the mergers and acquisitions. HUB International will foster your learning, support your endeavors, and encourage your growth. We provide opportunities for career-driven individuals to move upward in our organization. Our successes breed your opportunity!


#INDUS


#LI-JK


Department Account Management & Service
Required Experience: Less than 1 year of relevant experience
Required Travel: No Travel Required
Required Education: Some college (no degree)

title: First Vice President- Financial Institutions
description:
HUB International Limited (“HUB”) is the 5th largest global insurance broker, providing a broad array of property, casualty, risk management, life and health, employee benefits, investment and wealth management products and services. With over 15,000 employees in 750 offices throughout North America, HUB has grown substantially, in part due to our industry leading success in mergers and acquisitions. HUB International Northeast is a division of a leading international insurance brokerage selling and servicing all lines of insurance.
We currently have an opportunity for a First Vice President – Financial Institutions. This position will build a book of professional risks by cultivating in house client relationships and writing new business. This role will report directly to ProEx Northeast Practice Leader.


This leadership position will have accountability for building and developing an industry leading portfolio of Executive liability clients by cultivating in house client and colleague relationships, developing a comprehensive service proposition for clients, managing deep insurer relationships and developing strong sales and cross-sell capability for Executive liability insurance products.


This position is open to our NJ, NJ, & PA locations.

**Leadership Responsibilities:**

* Accountability for all aspects of Executive Liability Value Proposition
* Accountability for profitability and growth targets as agreed by senior leadership
* Accountability for recruitment, training and development of staff within specific mandate
* Responsible for fostering and developing meaningful collaborative relationships with internal colleagues, teams and leaders as well as external partners, insurers and service providers.
* Accountability for development and driving performance of strong sales culture
* Accountability for team fostering and development of meaningful client relationships

**Specific Role Responsibilities:**

* Accountability for effectively marketing Executive Liability coverages to our current book of retail clients and to work with Hub producers to cultivate new customers.
* Responsibility for team’s effective developing relationships with current Hub Commercial Lines service leaders and producers to become their professional resource for all things Executive Lines.
* Evaluating and identifying Executive exposures.
* Negotiating terms and conditions of the insurance contracts with the carriers.
* Consistently developing a creative and customized insurance program to protect the insured.
* Consistently developing presentation of solutions for the agent/insured.
* Primary accountability for new business growth via production goals.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Experience Requirements:**

* 15+ years of relevant experience.
* Strong oral and written communication skills.
* Strong presentation and organizational skills.
* Results-driven mind-set.
* Ability to deliver client-focused solutions that contribute to long-lasting relationships.
* Travel to agent and client locations as required (some overnight stays).
* Maintain a valid P&C insurance license.
* Hold a professional designation.
* Bachelors degree preferred

**Additional Skills/Attributes:**

* Juris Doctor, MBA or other advanced degree
* Former leadership, team development and performance management experience.
* Ability to collaborate and leverage operational, new business and technology opportunities


The expected pay range for this position is $230,000 to $240,000 and will be impacted by factors such as the successful candidate’s skills, experience, and work location, as well as the specific position’s business line, scope, and level. HUB International is proud to offer comprehensive benefit and total compensation packages which could include health/dental/vision/life/disability insurance, FSA, HSA and 401(k) accounts, paid-time-off benefits, and commissions for some positions.


Department Account Management & Service
Required Experience: More than 15 years of relevant experience
Required Travel: Negligible
Required Education: Bachelor's degree (4-year degree)
